comments:
If I change the modifier key to Alt, the browse doesn't work.  The text
highlites like a hyperlink on mouseover, but mouse-click doesn't do anything.

I am using 3.0 Build id: 200310060010 on the Linux GTK platform.

Incidentally, this didn't work on the 3.0M3 build on Linux GTK either.  It does,
however, work correctly on WinXP.

As can be seen from the stack trace the editor tries to open the type but fails
in J Core code.

I've verified that changing modifier key to Alt both for Hover on Source and 
Hyperlink navigation also works on Win 2000 (as on WinXP).

Would it be possible to try with another VM to verify that it is not a problem 
of a specific one on Mac OS?

Just to clarify, this is a problem on Linux, not Mac OS.  Having said that, the
alternate JVM is a good idea.  I'll work on that and let you know the results.
I tested this with the IBM 1.4.1 JVM with the same results.
I tested this with the 3.0M4 version, and it is still broken.

HandleFactory was completely rewritten while fixing bug 47214 and bug 47795.
Is there any chance that this has fixed this problem?

I'll get the next M release and try it in there.  If it works, I'll close the
bug, otherwise, I'll make a note.

Reassign to jdt-ui for investigation. Testing with M8 and M9 Linux builds, as
expected after chnages done in Handlefactory, we no longer have the NPE in jdt-core.
However, after having changed from Ctrl to Alt key for Java editor Navigation, I
confirm that the browse still does not work...
Tom, can you reproduce this on Linux?

Reproducable.

The Alt modifier conflicts with a platform feature: on KDE (at least, might be
with Gnome as well), Alt and Mouse are per default used to operate on the window
(Left mouse button: move, MMB: Toggle Raise / Lower, RMB: resize). 

If you disable this (on KDE: Control Center -> Desktop -> Window Behaviour,
Actions tab), Alt works fine for hyperlinking.
